name: Aura Blast
oracle_text: Destroy target enchantment.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: "None of your history books mention me?" laughed Daria. "They will now."

rulings.text: You don’t draw a card if this spell is countered or if the target is illegal on resolution.
You still draw a card if the enchantment regenerates.

name: Aurora Griffin
oracle_text: Flying
{W}: Target permanent becomes white until end of turn.
flavor_text: Though a fierce fighter, its true value is that it inspires beleaguered forces.

name: Disciple of Kangee
oracle_text: {U}, {T}: Target creature gains flying and becomes blue until end of turn.
flavor_text: When no birds are available, Kangee's disciples fill the sky with anything that‘s willing to fight.

name: Dominaria's Judgment
oracle_text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain protection from white if you control a Plains, from blue if you control an Island, from black if you control a Swamp, from red if you control a Mountain, and from green if you control a Forest.

name: Guard Dogs
oracle_text: {2}{W}, {T}: Choose a permanent you control. Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn if it shares a color with that permanent.
flavor_text:
"A good guard is alert. A great guard is also loyal."
—Benalish kennelmaster

rulings.text: You choose the target on activation and choose the permanent which is compared for color on resolution.
You only check colors on resolution and not later when the damage prevention actually is applied.

name: Heroic Defiance
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 unless it shares a color with the most common color among all permanents or a color tied for most common.
flavor_text:
"Wear courage as your armor. Wield honor as your blade."
—Gerrard

name: Hobble
oracle_text: Enchant creature
When Hobble enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Enchanted creature can't block if it's black.

name: Honorable Scout
oracle_text: When Honorable Scout enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each black and/or red creature target opponent controls.
flavor_text: "I've faced your kind before. This time I'm ready for you."

rulings.text: If a creature is both black and red, you gain 2 life, not 4.

name: Lashknife Barrier
oracle_text: When Lashknife Barrier enters the battlefield, draw a card.
If a source would deal damage to a creature you control, it deals that much damage minus 1 to that creature instead.

name: March of Souls
oracle_text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. For each creature destroyed this way, its controller creates a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

name: Orim's Chant
oracle_text: Kicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} as you cast this spell.)
Target player can't cast spells this turn. If this spell was kicked, creatures can't attack this turn.

rulings.text: This spell does nothing to creatures which are already attacking. It does not remove attacking creatures from combat.
This spell does not affect the abilities of permanents. It only affects spells.
This can’t be used as a counterspell. It will have no effect on spells which were on the stack when it was cast, nor on those cast in response to it.

name: Planeswalker's Mirth
oracle_text: {3}{W}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. You gain life equal to that card's converted mana cost.
flavor_text:
"I enjoy a good joke as much as the next guy."
—Commodore Guff

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then no life is gained.

name: Pollen Remedy
oracle_text: Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of targets, divided as you choose. If this spell was kicked, prevent the next 6 damage this way instead.

rulings.text: You can’t choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and 3 (or 6) targets.

name: Samite Elder
oracle_text: {T}: Creatures you control gain protection from the colors of target permanent you control until end of turn.

rulings.text: If the color of that permanent changes after the ability takes effect, the color of protection that was granted does not change.
The color is determined on resolution.

name: Samite Pilgrim
oracle_text: Domain — {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

name: Sunscape Battlemage
oracle_text: Kicker {1}{G} and/or {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} and/or {2}{U} as you cast this spell.)
When Sunscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{G} kicker, destroy target creature with flying.
When Sunscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{U} kicker, draw two cards.

name: Sunscape Familiar
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Green spells and blue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor_text: The spirits of fallen battlemages can serve their guilds as familiars by joining with any physical form.

rulings.text: If a spell is both green and blue, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, “only black mana can be spent this way”. This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell’s cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell’s cost, the cost reduction still applies.

name: Surprise Deployment
oracle_text: Cast this spell only during combat.
You may put a nonwhite creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. At the beginning of the next end step, return that creature to your hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

name: Voice of All
oracle_text: Flying
As Voice of All enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color.

name: Allied Strategies
oracle_text: Domain — Target player draws a card for each basic land type among lands they control.
flavor_text: Each commander looked at the others and wondered who would be first to break the alliance.

rulings.text: You draw one card per basic land type, not for each basic land. This makes it a maximum of 5 cards.

To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

name: Arctic Merfolk
oracle_text: Kicker—Return a creature you control to its owner's hand. (You may return a creature you control to its owner's hand in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
If Arctic Merfolk was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Confound
oracle_text: Counter target spell that targets a creature.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: "Did I know Szat would betray us?" Urza asked quizzically. "I was counting on it."

rulings.text: Confound doesn’t resolve if the targeted spell has been countered or does not still target one or more permanents that are still creatures and are still on the battlefield. Confound is different from other such spells in that it actually specifies that the spell must target a creature, not just be able to target a creature or that the spell has a certain number of targets.

name: Dralnu's Pet
oracle_text: Kicker—{2}{B}, Discard a creature card. (You may pay {2}{B} and discard a creature card in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
If Dralnu's Pet was kicked, it enters the battlefield with flying and with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: If the Dralnu’s Pet is kicked, Dralnu’s Pet will have flying from the moment it enters the battlefield. This will trigger abilities that look for a creature with flying entering the battlefield.

name: Ertai's Trickery
oracle_text: Counter target spell if it was kicked.
flavor_text: "Don't worry, Gerrard," said Ertai. "I'm sure the crew will come to your rescue as quickly as they came to mine."

rulings.text: You can target any spell, but that spell will be countered only if it was kicked.

name: Escape Routes
oracle_text: {2}{U}: Return target white or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"I'll get you to safety—or whatever passes for safety these days."
—Urborg ferry pilot

name: Gainsay
oracle_text: Counter target blue spell.
flavor_text:
"I'd be happy to stop contradicting you, Urza, just as soon as you start being right."
—Bo Levar, planeswalker

name: Hunting Drake
oracle_text: Flying
When Hunting Drake enters the battlefield, put target red or green creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor_text: Even the fiercest beast will flee when faced with the possibility of becoming dinner.

rulings.text: If the target changes color from red to green or green to red between triggering and resolution, the ability still works.

name: Planar Overlay
oracle_text: Each player chooses a land they control of each basic land type. Return those lands to their owners' hands.
flavor_text: The Phyrexians don't want to conquer Dominaria. They want to remake it.

rulings.text: If you have a land which counts as multiple land types, you can choose that land as each of those types. For example, a dual land could be chosen as two of your land types.

name: Planeswalker's Mischief
oracle_text: {3}{U}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. If it's an instant or sorcery card, exile it. You may cast it without paying its mana cost for as long as it remains exiled. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.) At the beginning of the next end step, if you haven't cast it, return it to its owner's hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then the ability does nothing.
If Planeswalker’s Mischief leaves the battlefield, any cards it exiled are still under the effect of the ability and can be cast (and if they are not cast, they are returned to the owner’s hand).
When cast, the card goes to its owner’s graveyard after it resolves.

name: Rushing River
oracle_text: Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. If this spell was kicked, return another target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice a tapped land.
You choose a second target only if you choose to pay the Kicker cost.

name: Sea Snidd
oracle_text: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
flavor_text: It always has the home-turf advantage.

name: Shifting Sky
oracle_text: As Shifting Sky enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All nonland permanents are the chosen color.
flavor_text:
Master the sky and you rule everything beneath it.
—Metathran saying

name: Sisay's Ingenuity
oracle_text: Enchant creature
When Sisay's Ingenuity enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has "{2}{U}: Target creature becomes the color of your choice until end of turn."

name: Sleeping Potion
oracle_text: Enchant creature
When Sleeping Potion enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice Sleeping Potion.

name: Stormscape Battlemage
oracle_text: Kicker {W} and/or {2}{B} (You may pay an additional {W} and/or {2}{B} as you cast this spell.)
When Stormscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {W} kicker, you gain 3 life.
When Stormscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{B} kicker, destroy target nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

name: Stormscape Familiar
oracle_text: Flying
White spells and black spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor_text: Each Stormscape apprentice must hand-raise and train an owl before attaining the rank of master.

rulings.text: If a spell is both white and black, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, “only black mana can be spent this way”. This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell’s cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell’s cost, the cost reduction still applies.

name: Sunken Hope
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: While Dominarians fought for their world, Rath stole it from under their feet.

name: Waterspout Elemental
oracle_text: Kicker {U} (You may pay an additional {U} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Waterspout Elemental enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, return all other creatures to their owners' hands and you skip your next turn.

rulings.text: It affects your creatures as well as your opponent’s.

name: Bog Down
oracle_text: Kicker—Sacrifice two lands. (You may sacrifice two lands in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Target player discards two cards. If this spell was kicked, that player discards three cards instead.

rulings.text: The player discards 2 cards or 3 cards, not 5 cards.

name: Dark Suspicions
oracle_text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player loses X life, where X is the number of cards in that player's hand minus the number of cards in your hand.
flavor_text:
"After four thousand years, you learn to plan for betrayal."
—Urza

name: Death Bomb
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller loses 2 life.
flavor_text: There's no higher honor in Phyrexia than dying for Yawgmoth's glorious vision.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

name: Diabolic Intent
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You must choose a card if there are any in your library.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

name: Exotic Disease
oracle_text: Domain — Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor_text:
"Do not fear death. I shall release you from the eternal bonds and bring you glory."
—Lord Dralnu

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

name: Lord of the Undead
oracle_text: Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text:
"I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
—Lord Dralnu

rulings.text: Lord of the Undead now has the Zombie creature type and its first ability has been reworded to affect *other* Zombies. This means that if two Lord of the Undead are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

name: Maggot Carrier
oracle_text: When Maggot Carrier enters the battlefield, each player loses 1 life.
flavor_text:
"The mere sight of our undead allies sickens me. What unholy bargain have you struck?"
—Grizzlegom, to Agnate

name: Morgue Toad
oracle_text: Sacrifice Morgue Toad: Add {U}{R}.
flavor_text:
"The toads of Urborg aren't fast, powerful, or pleasant, but they have their uses."
—Ertai

name: Nightscape Battlemage
oracle_text: Kicker {2}{U} and/or {2}{R} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} and/or {2}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Nightscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{U} kicker, return up to two target nonblack creatures to their owners' hands.
When Nightscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{R} kicker, destroy target land.

name: Nightscape Familiar
oracle_text: Blue spells and red spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Nightscape Familiar.
flavor_text: Nightscape masters don't stop at raising the spirit of a fallen battlemage. They raise the flesh along with it.

rulings.text: If a spell is both blue and red, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, “only black mana can be spent this way”. This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell’s cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell’s cost, the cost reduction still applies.

name: Noxious Vapors
oracle_text: Each player reveals their hand, chooses one card of each color from it, then discards all other nonland cards.
flavor_text: Urborg would just as soon steal your memories as your life.

name: Phyrexian Bloodstock
oracle_text: When Phyrexian Bloodstock leaves the battlefield, destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text: It reeks of terror and chaos.

name: Phyrexian Scuta
oracle_text: Kicker—Pay 3 life. (You may pay 3 life in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
If Phyrexian Scuta was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

name: Planeswalker's Scorn
oracle_text: {3}{B}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the revealed card's converted mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then X is zero.

name: Shriek of Dread
oracle_text: Target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor_text: When Crosis roared, the battle ended and the slaughter began.

name: Sinister Strength
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1 and is black.
flavor_text:
"I bless the living with a song of death."
—Lord Dralnu

name: Slay
oracle_text: Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.

rulings.text: You don’t draw a card if this spell is countered.

name: Volcano Imp
oracle_text: Flying
{1}{R}: Volcano Imp gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor_text: Its claws cut faster than a flame flickers.

name: Warped Devotion
oracle_text: Whenever a permanent is returned to a player's hand, that player discards a card.
flavor_text:
"Before the glory of Yawgmoth, yes, even this makes sense."
—Urza, to Gerrard

rulings.text: This card can trigger on itself being returned to a player’s hand.

name: Caldera Kavu
oracle_text: {1}{B}: Caldera Kavu gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{G}: Caldera Kavu becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
flavor_text: As powerful and malleable as the molten rock it calls home.

rulings.text: You choose a color on resolution.

name: Deadapult
oracle_text: {R}, Sacrifice a Zombie: Deadapult deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor_text:
"Nothing ruins your day like a blazing zombie."
—Tahngarth

name: Flametongue Kavu
oracle_text: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.
flavor_text:
"For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim."
—Sisay

rulings.text: If it enters the battlefield as the only targetable creature, it must target itself.

name: Goblin Game
oracle_text: Each player hides at least one item, then all players reveal them simultaneously. Each player loses life equal to the number of items they revealed. The player who revealed the fewest items then loses half their life, rounded up. If two or more players are tied for fewest, each loses half their life, rounded up.

rulings.text: When it comes to choice of items, use common sense. Items should be small enough to hide but large enough to count. Make it clear what kind of object you are hiding beforehand. For example, one player may choose coins and the other may choose dice. If you can’t find something convenient to hide, write numbers on a piece of paper and reveal the numbers. Make sure the numbers are unambiguous (for example, underline a 6 or 9 so it can’t be misread).
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

name: Implode
oracle_text: Destroy target land.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: To save Dominaria, nine planeswalkers sought the annihilation of Phyrexia itself.

name: Insolence
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Insolence deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor_text:
"Sacrificing mortal dragons to satisfy your immortal hunger ends here."
—Darigaaz, to Rith

rulings.text: The damaging ability triggers no matter how the creature becomes tapped.
It does not trigger immediately when cast targeting an already tapped creature.

name: Kavu Recluse
oracle_text: {T}: Target land becomes a Forest until end of turn.
flavor_text: Few ever see this particular breed of kavu, which hides in forests of its own making.

name: Keldon Mantle
oracle_text: Enchant creature
{B}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Enchanted creature gains trample until end of turn.

name: Magma Burst
oracle_text: Kicker—Sacrifice two lands. (You may sacrifice two lands in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Magma Burst deals 3 damage to any target. If this spell was kicked, it deals 3 damage to another target.

rulings.text: The second target must be different from the first one.
You choose a second target only if you choose to pay the Kicker cost.

name: Mire Kavu
oracle_text: Mire Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
flavor_text: "At this rate," said Sisay, "the next kavu we see will have wings."

name: Mogg Jailer
oracle_text: Mogg Jailer can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 2 or less.
flavor_text:
Hey, wake up
—Mogg secret password

name: Mogg Sentry
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Nobody stands in one place better than a mogg."
—Tahngarth

name: Planeswalker's Fury
oracle_text: {3}{R}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. Planeswalker's Fury deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that player. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then no damage is dealt.

name: Singe
oracle_text: Singe deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature becomes black until end of turn.
flavor_text: Burnt flesh. Blackened soul.

name: Slingshot Goblin
oracle_text: {R}, {T}: Slingshot Goblin deals 2 damage to target blue creature.
flavor_text: It's most effective when it doesn't eat the ammunition.

name: Strafe
oracle_text: Strafe deals 3 damage to target nonred creature.
flavor_text:
"All right, let's light ‘em up"
—Gerrard

name: Tahngarth, Talruum Hero
oracle_text: Vigilance
{1}{R}, {T}: Tahngarth, Talruum Hero deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Tahngarth.

name: Tahngarth, Talruum Hero
oracle_text: Vigilance
{1}{R}, {T}: Tahngarth, Talruum Hero deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Tahngarth.

name: Thunderscape Battlemage
oracle_text: Kicker {1}{B} and/or {G} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} and/or {G} as you cast this spell.)
When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, target player discards two cards.
When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {G} kicker, destroy target enchantment.

name: Thunderscape Familiar
oracle_text: First strike
Black spells and green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor_text: Thunderscape masters release familiars to help guide their apprentices down the thunderscape path.

rulings.text: If a spell is both black and green, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, “only black mana can be spent this way”. This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell’s cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell’s cost, the cost reduction still applies.

name: Alpha Kavu
oracle_text: {1}{G}: Target Kavu creature gets -1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Kavu leaders instinctively protect their herds from harm.

name: Amphibious Kavu
oracle_text: Whenever Amphibious Kavu blocks or becomes blocked by one or more blue and/or black creatures, Amphibious Kavu gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Merfolk raided the shores untroubled for years . . . until the shores started fighting back.

rulings.text: The ability only triggers once per combat.

name: Falling Timber
oracle_text: Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn. If this spell was kicked, prevent all combat damage another target creature would deal this turn.

rulings.text: You pick a second target only if you choose to kick Falling Timber.

name: Gaea's Herald
oracle_text: Creature spells can't be countered.
flavor_text: "I bring word from Gaea. Fight on She will never allow her children to die alone."

rulings.text: The ability applies to your opponent’s spells as well as your own.

name: Gaea's Might
oracle_text: Domain — Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor_text: With the Heart of Yavimaya aiding him, Multani didn't even strain at the load.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

name: Magnigoth Treefolk
oracle_text: Domain — For each basic land type among lands you control, Magnigoth Treefolk has landwalk of that type. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of that type.)

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

name: Mirrorwood Treefolk
oracle_text: {2}{R}{W}: The next time damage would be dealt to Mirrorwood Treefolk this turn, that damage is dealt to any target instead.
flavor_text: It doesn't need a bite. The bark works just fine.

rulings.text: If the target creature is not on the battlefield (or is not a creature) at the time the damage would be redirected, then the damage goes on this card.

The ability applies to the next time damage is dealt. Normally this means damage from one source at one time, but during combat it is possible for multiple sources to damage the Treefolk at one time, in which case damage from all of those sources is redirected.

name: Multani's Harmony
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
flavor_text: "Welcome to paradise."

name: Nemata, Grove Guardian
oracle_text: {2}{G}: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Saproling creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Planeswalker's Favor
oracle_text: {3}{G}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the revealed card's converted mana cost.
flavor_text: Freyalise strengthens her faithful.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then X is zero.

name: Primal Growth
oracle_text: Kicker—Sacrifice a creature. (You may sacrifice a creature in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)

Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. If this spell was kicked, instead search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You may choose not to find any basic lands when you search.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

name: Pygmy Kavu
oracle_text: When Pygmy Kavu enters the battlefield, draw a card for each black creature your opponents control.
flavor_text:
"We could learn a lot by watching the little ones," said Agnate.
"Define ‘little,'" replied Grizzlegom.

name: Quirion Dryad
oracle_text: Whenever you cast a white, blue, black, or red spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Quirion Dryad.
flavor_text:
"Never underestimate the ability of natural forces to adapt to unnatural influences."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: Quirion Dryad’s ability will trigger only once per spell you cast, as long as that spell is at least one of the listed colors.
Quirion Dryad’s ability will trigger if you cast a spell that’s green and at least one of the listed colors.

name: Quirion Explorer
oracle_text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
flavor_text:
Fight with a friend at your back, steel in your hands, and magic in your veins.
—Quirion creed

rulings.text: If the opponent only has lands that produce colorless or no mana, this card’s ability can still be activated; it just won’t produce any mana.

name: Root Greevil
oracle_text: {2}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Root Greevil: Destroy all enchantments of the color of your choice.
flavor_text: The root of all greevils.

name: Skyshroud Blessing
oracle_text: All lands gain shroud until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
Draw a card.
flavor_text: "Behold," said Freyalise to Eladamri. "Your Skyshroud home has followed you to Dominaria."

rulings.text: This affects your lands and your opponent’s.

name: Stone Kavu
oracle_text: {R}: Stone Kavu gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{W}: Stone Kavu gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: To maintain its hide, it consumes a variety of rocks—not to mention a variety of Phyrexians.

name: Thornscape Battlemage
oracle_text: Kicker {R} and/or {W} (You may pay an additional {R} and/or {W} as you cast this spell.)
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {R} kicker, it deals 2 damage to any target.
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {W} kicker, destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: You choose whether to kick a spell as you cast it, and you pay that much along with the spell’s mana cost at the same time. Kicking a spell is always optional.
You can pay any particular kicker cost only once. You can’t pay it multiple times to get multiples of either triggered ability.
If Thornscape Battlemage is put onto the battlefield as the result of a spell or ability, there’s no opportunity to kick it.
Kicker costs don’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost.

name: Thornscape Familiar
oracle_text: Red spells and white spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
flavor_text: Blessed with many options, Thornscape masters favor scarabs as familiars.

rulings.text: If a spell is both red and white, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, “only black mana can be spent this way”. This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell’s cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell’s cost, the cost reduction still applies.

name: Ancient Spider
oracle_text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor_text: It outlived both king and castle.

name: Cavern Harpy
oracle_text: Flying
When Cavern Harpy enters the battlefield, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
Pay 1 life: Return Cavern Harpy to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

name: Cloud Cover
oracle_text: Whenever another permanent you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, you may return that permanent to its owner's hand.

name: Crosis's Charm
oracle_text: Choose one —
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
• Destroy target artifact.

name: Darigaaz's Charm
oracle_text: Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Darigaaz's Charm deals 3 damage to any target.
• Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Daring Leap
oracle_text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying and first strike until end of turn.
flavor_text: Most warriors think in only two dimensions. Agnate and his metathran brethren were trained to battle in three.

rulings.text: If used after a blocker is assigned your creature is still blocked.

name: Destructive Flow
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a nonbasic land.
flavor_text: Stage two of the Phyrexian invasion included the complete alteration of Dominaria's landscape.

name: Doomsday Specter

When Doomsday Specter enters the battlefield, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
Whenever Doomsday Specter deals combat damage to a player, look at that player's hand and choose a card from it. The player discards that card.

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

name: Dralnu's Crusade
oracle_text: Goblin creatures get +1/+1.
All Goblins are black and are Zombies in addition to their other creature types.
flavor_text:
"Don't you agree that mogg intellects are improved by zombification?"
—Lord Dralnu

rulings.text: The Goblins are both Goblins and Zombies and they are black (they lose their previous color(s)).
This only affects Goblins which are on the battlefield. Ones in your graveyard, library, etc. are not changed to be black or to be Zombies.

name: Dromar's Charm
oracle_text: Choose one —

• Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

name: Eladamri's Call
oracle_text: Search your library for a creature card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: Tribal rivalries and petty disputes were laid aside at Eladamri's summons.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

oracle_text: {U}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature or enchantment: Counter target spell.
flavor_text: Altered by Phyrexian science, corrupted by black mana, and twisted by rage, Ertai still looked in the mirror and saw only glory.

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if no creatures attacked this turn, that player sacrifices a creature they controlled since the beginning of the turn.

When Marsh Crocodile enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.

rulings.text: Both triggered abilities trigger at the same time so you can decide which order they go on the stack.
This card can return itself to your hand.
You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

name: Meddling Mage
oracle_text: As Meddling Mage enters the battlefield, choose a nonland card name.
Spells with the chosen name can't be cast.
flavor_text: Meddling mages chant so loudly that no one can get a spell in edgewise.

rulings.text: No one can cast spells or activate abilities between the time a card is named and the time that Meddling Mage’s ability starts to work.
Spells with the chosen name that somehow happen to already be on the stack when Meddling Mage enters the battlefield are not affected by Meddling Mage’s ability.
Although the named card can’t be cast, it can still be put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability (if it’s a permanent card).
You can name either half of a split card, but not both. If you do so, that half (and both halves, if the split card has fuse) can’t be cast. The other half is unaffected.
If a card with morph is named, that card may still be cast face down. Face-down cards have no names.
Once Meddling Mage leaves the battlefield, the named card can be cast again.

name: Natural Emergence
oracle_text: When Natural Emergence enters the battlefield, return a red or green enchantment you control to its owner's hand.
Lands you control are 2/2 creatures with first strike. They're still lands.

rulings.text: You choose the enchantment to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the “summoning sickness” rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn.

name: Phyrexian Tyranny
oracle_text: Whenever a player draws a card, that player loses 2 life unless they pay {2}.

rulings.text: If more than one card is drawn at a time, this triggers for each card drawn.
